floors.name: Town of Beginnings
info: Floor 1 is home to the Iconic Town of beginnings as shown in 'Aincrad'.
This is where players first start the game.
You can find the starter shop, event shop, blacksmith, an inn, cole's cuts, as well as a fishing spot.
Behind the teleport Pad, there is the Iconic 'Black Iron Palace', Some events are hosted here but it is used as a place of history.
lore: Floor 1 is where the system first locks you in — a safe zone that feels calm for a reason.
Most players gather here before stepping into real combat zones.
The Black Iron Palace is treated like a monument… and a warning.

mobs.name: Training Dummy
mobs.notes: Hitting these will show you your attack damage and crit damage.

quests.name: Tutorial
quests.notes: You can start the tutorial at any point.

callouts.label: Starter Shop
callouts.desc: Basic starter gear, early supplies, and the first prices players learn to fear.

callouts.label: Potion Shop
callouts.desc: Potions and recovery items. The line here gets longer after every raid attempt.

callouts.label: Blacksmith
callouts.desc: Upgrades, forging, and repairs. The sound of metal here is the floor’s heartbeat.

callouts.label: Event Shop
callouts.desc: Limited stock, rotating rewards, and items that vanish the moment you hesitate.

callouts.label: Cole’s Cuts
callouts.desc: Cosmetic changes and styling. Because even trapped players still want to look cute.

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: The first place you wake up. The last place you can pretend it’s a game.

callouts.label: Black Iron Palace
callouts.desc: A monument of polished stone and cold silence. It feels like the system is watching from inside.

floors.systemNote: Floor 1 is the primary safe hub for new players.

floors.name: Swordsman Fields
info: First Combat Area, this is the first floor players begin leveling up.
Getting levels on this floor is slow at first, so it is ideal that you find a guild or party.
There is also a town on this floor you can buy potions and some gear. You can also aquire guild uniforms here.
lore: Swordsman Fields is where safety ends and survival begins. Beyond the Town of Beginnings, the land opens into rolling plains filled with restless monsters and inexperienced adventurers testing their strength.

The fields appear peaceful at first glance — wind through tall grass, distant hills, scattered ruins — but danger spawns relentlessly. Boars charge without warning, wolves hunt in packs, and hesitation is punished swiftly.

mobs.name: Kobold Sentinel
mobs.drops: GrandMaster Steel Blade, GrandMaster Steel Dagger

mobs.name: Kobold Sentinel
mobs.drops: GrandMaster Steel Blade, GrandMaster Steel Dagger

mobs.name: Kobold Sentinel
mobs.drops: GrandMaster Steel Blade, GrandMaster Steel Dagger

mobs.name: Corrupted Sentinel
mobs.drops: GrandMaster Steel Greatsword, GrandMaster Steel Rapier

mobs.name: Corrupted Sentinel
mobs.drops: GrandMaster Steel Greatsword, GrandMaster Steel Rapier

mobs.name: Corrupted Sentinel
mobs.drops: GrandMaster Steel Greatsword, GrandMaster Steel Rapier

bosses.name: Illfang the Kobold Lord
bosses.drops: Iron Ore (0-2), Copper Ore (0-2), Illfangs Tooth, Illfangs Shield, Coat of Midnight (Last Hit)

quests.name: Gain Sword Skills
quests.notes: Q#03 • Interval: Quarter Hour • Prerequisites: None • NPC: right outside the Spawn Pad.

quests.name: Clear the Fields
quests.notes: Q#04 • Interval: Half Hour • Prerequisites: None • NPC: along the left cobblestone path to the Dungeon, just before the mine crater.

quests.name: Hunt in the Woods
quests.notes: Q#05 • Interval: Hourly • Prerequisites: None • NPC: on the fishing bridge behind the town.

quests.name: Fight Dungeon Minions
quests.notes: Q#06 • Interval: Hourly • Prerequisites: None • NPC: inside the 1st-tier red Dungeon level, in the large open room.

quests.name: Defeat Mysterious Monster
quests.objective: Kill 1 Shadesworn the Corrupted, Kill 20 Corrupted Sentinels
quests.notes: Q#07 • Interval: One-Time • Prerequisites: None • NPC: inside the 2nd-tier blue Dungeon level, in the large open room.

quests.name: Locate Admin Console
quests.notes: Q#08 • Interval: One-Time • Prerequisites: None • NPC: inside the 2nd-tier blue Dungeon level, near a hall entrance off the great room.

quests.name: Fear of the Boss
quests.notes: Q#09 • Interval: One-Time • Prerequisites: None • NPC: inside the 2nd-tier blue Dungeon level, near one of the doors on a wall of the great room.

quests.name: The Boss Hunt
quests.notes: Q#10 • Interval: One-Time • Prerequisites: None • NPC: inside the Boss Room, hiding in a corner.

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Your last breath of safety before the fields start collecting mistakes.

callouts.label: Village
callouts.desc: A fragile pocket of calm. A place for regrouping, trading, and quiet panic.

callouts.label: Guild Merchants
callouts.desc: Supplies favored by organized parties. The prices assume you’re not alone.

callouts.label: Shop
callouts.desc: Standard supplies. If you’re underprepared here, the fields will notice.

callouts.label: Mine
callouts.desc: Materials and danger in equal measure. Echoes carry… and so do mobs.

callouts.label: Tower
callouts.desc: Illfang’s domain. Always visible. Always waiting.

floors.systemNote: Floor 2 is the beginning floor for leveling.

floors.name: Swamp Land
info: Floor 3 is a small swamp.
There isn't a lot to do on floor 3 besides the boss.
The tower should be visible everywhere on the floor.
lore: The Swamp Lands is where warmth dies and comfort becomes a memory. The air hangs heavy and damp, clinging to armor and skin alike.
At first glance the marsh seems still — but the silence is deceptive.

bosses.name: Lord Slug
bosses.drops: Malachite Ore (0-2), Corundum Ore (0-2), Lord Slugs Slime, Legendary Malachite Blade

quests.name: Reptile Rampage
quests.objective: Kill 10 Swamp Cobra, Kill 10 Swamp Snakes

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Fog, wet stone, and that immediate chill that crawls under your armor.

callouts.label: Shop
callouts.desc: Supplies for people who learned the swamp punishes ‘I’ll be fine.’

callouts.label: Tower
callouts.desc: The Slime Caverns. A shape in the mist that never feels far enough away.

floors.systemNote: Floor 3 is a swamp. Damp and cold.

floors.name: Desert Land
info: Floor 4 is larger in size compared to floor 3, but it is pretty simple to navigate.
From spawn there is 2 shops ahead of you. One forward to the left and the other near the village exit.
Outside the walls there are 3 paths. Straight takes you to the canyon. Left takes you to a spot most use as an sk farm. Right takes you around to the tower in a scenic way.
Floor 4 does have a gold mine in the canyon.
It is generally a good idea to have help on this floor, especially if you are in the lower levels.
lore: Floor 4 greets players not with cold or rain — but with heat that suffocates.
Sandstorms can turn short journeys into dangerous gambles.

bosses.name: Stallord
bosses.drops: Gold Ore (0-2), Stallords Eye, Pharaoh's Edge

quests.name: Scorpions in the Sand
quests.objective: Kill 20 Sand Scorpions, Kill 10 Blood Scorpions

quests.name: Dungeon Infestation
quests.objective: Kill 15 Blood Scorpions, Kill 15 Albino Scorpions

quests.name: Boulder Barrier
quests.reward: 2500 EXP, 3600 Col, Unlocks the left side of the Desert

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Small village accompanied by floor 4's shops and some quest NPC's.

callouts.label: Relic Ruins
callouts.desc: Ancient mine in the side of the canyon with gold ores.

callouts.label: Canyon Pass
callouts.desc: A narrow route with bad sightlines. Ambush territory—especially during storms.

callouts.label: Tower
callouts.desc: Stallord’s domain. If the wind changes direction, it’s already too late.

floors.name: Icy Caverns
info: A snowy mountainous floor with dangerous ice routes and a dungeon leading to the boss.
lore: Snow falls constantly and the floor feels like it never warms.
The deeper you go, the more the ice feels alive.

mobs.name: Frost Chaurus
mobs.drops: Bourne Ore, Legendary Stalhrim Blade, Crystalized Edge

mobs.name: Frost Chaurus
mobs.drops: Bourne Ore, Legendary Stalhrim Blade, Crystalized Edge

mobs.name: Frost Chaurus
mobs.drops: Bourne Ore, Legendary Stalhrim Blade, Crystalized Edge

mobs.name: White Baby Wyrm
mobs.drops: Bourne Ore, Blade of Ice, Frostberge Skewer

mobs.name: White Baby Wyrm
mobs.drops: Bourne Ore, Blade of Ice, Frostberge Skewer

mobs.name: White Baby Wyrm
mobs.drops: Bourne Ore, Blade of Ice, Frostberge Skewer

bosses.name: X'rphan the White Wyrm
bosses.drops: Bourne Ore (0-2), Xrphans Feather, Auroras Cloak

quests.name: Wolves on the run
quests.objective: Kill 8 Winter Wolves, Find the Mountain Bridge

quests.name: Trapped in the Cabin
quests.objective: Kill 10 Frost Chaurus, Kill 10 Winter Wolves, Find the Cabin NPC

quests.name: The Dragon Dilemma
quests.objective: Kill 20 White Baby Wyrms, Find the Dungeon Entrance

quests.name: The White Wyrm!
quests.objective: Kill 10 White Baby Wyrms, Kill X'rphan the White Wyrm

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Cold air. Crunching snow. The floor welcomes you with silence.

callouts.label: Cabin Area
callouts.desc: A tiny pocket of warmth that feels suspiciously fragile.

callouts.label: Ice Maze
callouts.desc: A winding maze of ice walls. Every wrong turn wastes warmth.

callouts.label: Dungeon Entrance
callouts.desc: The air gets sharper near the entrance—like the ice is watching.

callouts.label: Boss Room
callouts.desc: The wyrm’s domain. The snow here feels… too still.

floors.systemNote: Ice floor with maze + wyrm boss.

floors.name: Hellfire Wasteland
info: A hell-themed floor with lava hazards. Lava can instantly kill you.
Two major paths: one deeper into the floor, one into an open area.
lore: The air is heavy, the ground scorched, and mistakes melt fast.

mobs.name: Bloodsilk Spider
mobs.drops: Demonite, Spider Potion, Volcanic Blade, Molten Lance

mobs.name: Bloodsilk Spider
mobs.drops: Demonite, Spider Potion, Volcanic Blade, Molten Lance

mobs.name: Bloodsilk Spider
mobs.drops: Demonite, Spider Potion, Volcanic Blade, Molten Lance

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Heat hits first. Then the smell of smoke. Then the panic.

callouts.label: Safe Ridge
callouts.desc: A narrow strip of ground that isn’t actively trying to kill you.

callouts.label: Lava Lake
callouts.desc: One slip and you’re done. No warnings. No mercy.

callouts.label: Maze / Ruins
callouts.desc: Tight corridors over glowing cracks. Don’t get cornered.

callouts.label: Boss Room
callouts.desc: The demon lord’s throne area. The air is heavier here.

floors.name: Luminara Grove
info: A mushroom-forest themed floor with branching routes.
Includes blacksmith access and multiple boss encounters.
lore: It feels alive — not in the comforting way.

mobs.name: Blue Ore Golem
mobs.drops: Iron Ore (0-2), Copper Ore (0-2), Bourne Ore (0-2), Mossy Stone (0-2)

mobs.name: Blue Ore Golem
mobs.drops: Iron Ore (0-2), Copper Ore (0-2), Bourne Ore (0-2), Mossy Stone (0-2)

mobs.name: Red Ore Golem
mobs.drops: Iron Ore (0-2), Copper Ore (0-2), Bourne Ore (0-2), Mossy Stone (0-2)

mobs.name: Red Ore Golem
mobs.drops: Iron Ore (0-2), Copper Ore (0-2), Bourne Ore (0-2), Mossy Stone (0-2)

bosses.name: Storm Atronach
bosses.drops: Angels Dust (0-2), Plasma Extract, Stone Armor, The Green Flame Sword

quests.name: Chomper Control
quests.notes: Floor 7 quests exist (Q#34–Q#39) on List of Quests page.

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Blue glow in the air. Mushrooms bigger than houses. Don’t trust the beauty.

callouts.label: Blacksmith / Hub
callouts.desc: A place to repair your gear and pretend everything is normal.

callouts.label: River Path
callouts.desc: A winding route through glowing growth. Easy to get turned around.

callouts.label: Dungeon Entrance
callouts.desc: The glow gets harsher near the entrance—like a warning light.

callouts.label: Boss Area
callouts.desc: Where the grove stops feeling alive and starts feeling hungry.

floors.name: Graves
info: A graveyard-themed floor with heavy undead farming near the dungeon entrance.
lore: Bones underfoot. Silence overhead. Something always moving just out of sight.

bosses.name: Bonnz the Skeleton Lord
bosses.drops: Bone Meal (0-2), Ebony Ore (0-2), Petrified Skull, Stone Shield, Skull of the Forgotten

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Gravestones and fog. The silence here feels staged.

callouts.label: Undead Farm
callouts.desc: The popular grind area. The dead respawn faster than comfort returns.

callouts.label: Dungeon Entrance
callouts.desc: A dark opening that swallows light and courage.

callouts.label: Boss Room
callouts.desc: Where the skeleton lord waits. You can almost hear bones smiling.

floors.systemNote: Popular leveling floor near dungeon entrance.

floors.name: Tropical Sea
info: A large seaside-themed floor with a massive dungeon and a hidden shop.
lore: It’s beautiful until you realize how much of it wants you dead.

bosses.name: Karth'uk The Crystal Kraken
bosses.drops: Scale, Sea Jewel, Krakens Beak, Krakens Platemail, Krakens Skin

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Salt air and bright water. The danger hides under the sparkle.

callouts.label: Dock / Fort
callouts.desc: Wooden platforms and watch posts. A staging point for sea runs.

callouts.label: Shipwreck
callouts.desc: Broken hulls and sharp boards. Loot… and ambushes.

callouts.label: Hidden Shop
callouts.desc: A shop tucked away from main paths. If you know, you know.

callouts.label: Dungeon Entrance
callouts.desc: The ocean goes dark near the entrance. That’s your warning.

callouts.label: Boss Room
callouts.desc: The kraken’s domain. The water feels… wrong here.

floors.name: Sakura Serenity
info: A feudal Japan-inspired floor with a walled town and branching paths outside.
lore: Quiet streets. Sharp steel. The calm here feels intentional.

callouts.label: Spawn
callouts.desc: Quiet lantern light and the sound of wind through gates.

callouts.label: Walled Town
callouts.desc: A calm center with shops and routes leading outward.

callouts.label: Training Grounds
callouts.desc: Wide paths and open spaces—perfect for duels and ambushes.

callouts.label: Outer Routes
callouts.desc: Branching paths where the samurai mobs roam.

callouts.label: Boss Room
callouts.desc: The enlightened one waits. The calm here feels manufactured.
